alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 3:19AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of DeSoto, eastern Tunica, western Tate and northern Quitman Counties through 345 AM CST... At 319 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Little Texas, or 16 miles west of Senatobia, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Senatobia, Coldwater, Tunica, Crenshaw, Lynchburg, Phillipp, Strayhorn, Eudora, Dubbs, North Tunica, Arkabutla, Little Texas, Gerlach Mill, Trinity, Cockrum and Savage. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
